Command.Caption: nop
Command.Description: No operation

Command.Caption: startafb
Command.Description: Start AFB

Command.Caption: stop
Command.Description: Stop phase (IDR or ALP)

Command.Caption: mov
Command.Description: Copy 16-bit word from memory to memory

Command.Caption: movmem
Command.Description: Copy array of 16-bit words from memory to memory

Command.Caption: movc
Command.Description: Write 16-bit word constant to memory

Command.Caption: movbc
Command.Description: Write 1-bit constant to memory

Command.Caption: wrfb
Command.Description: Read 16-bit word from memory and write to AFB input

Command.Caption: rdfb
Command.Description: Read 16-bit word from AFB output and write to memory

Command.Caption: wrfbc
Command.Description: Write 16-bit word constant to AFB input

Command.Caption: wrfbb
Command.Description: Read 1-bit from memory and write to AFB input

Command.Caption: rdfbb
Command.Description: Read 1-bit from AFB output and write to memory

Command.Caption: rdfbts
Command.Description: Read 16-bit word from AFB output, compare to constant and set flag if equal

Command.Caption: setmem
Command.Description: Set memory area to 16-bit word constant

Command.Caption: movb
Command.Description: Copy 1-bit from memory to memory

Command.Caption: nstart
Command.Description: Start AFB n-times

Command.Caption: appstart
Command.Description: Set ALP phase start address

Command.Caption: mov32
Command.Description: Copy 32-bit data from memory to memory

Command.Caption: movc32
Command.Description: Write 32-bit constant to memory

Command.Caption: wrfb32
Command.Description: Read 32-bit data from memory and write to AFB input

Command.Caption: rdfb32
Command.Description: Read 32-bit data from AFB output and write to memory

Command.Caption: wrfbc32
Command.Description: Write 32-bit constant to AFB input

Command.Caption: rdfbts32
Command.Description: Read 32-bit data from AFB output, compare to constant and set flag if equal

Command.Caption: movcf
Command.Description: Write 16-bit constant to memory if flag is set [rdfbts(32)]

Command.Caption: pmov
Command.Description: Copy 16-bit word from memory to memory written in prior cycle

Command.Caption: pmov32
Command.Description: Copy 32-bit data from memory to memory written in prior cycle

Command.Caption: fillb
Command.Description: Fill 16-bit word with 1-bit constant and write it to memory

Properties.Description: Multiplexor Block selects one of two input bus signals and output result in accordance with control signal.
Majority Block is intended to define majority decision in accordance with control signal and received configuration.
NOT Block outputs the logical inverse of the input in accordance with control signal.
XOR Block outputs the logical XOR operation for inputs in accordance with control signal.
OR Block outputs the logical OR operation for inputs in accordance with control signal.
Locking and simulation module
AND Block outputs the logical AND operation for inputs in accordance with control signal.
Adder Block with float data format
Adder Block with signed int data format
AND Block outputs the logical AND operation for inputs in accordance with control signal.
Comparator Block, equal single-precision floating-point comparison (dynamic deadband)
Comparator Block, greater than single-precision floating-point format comparison (dynamic hysteresis)
Comparator Block, less than single-precision floating-point comparison (dynamic hysteresis)
Comparator Block, not equal single-precision floating-point format comparison (dynamic deadband)
Comparator Block, equal single-precision floating-point comparison
Comparator Block, greater than single-precision floating-point format comparison
Comparator Block, less than single-precision floating-point comparison
Comparator Block, not equal single-precision floating-point format comparison
Comparator Block, equal 32-bit signed int comparison
Comparator Block, greater than 32-bit signed integer comparison
Comparator Block, less than 32-bit signed integer comparison
Comparator Block, not equal 32-bit signed integer comparison
Comparator Block, equal single-precision floating-point comparison with constant value
Comparator Block, greater than single-precision floating-point format comparison with constant value
Comparator Block, less than single-precision floating-point comparison with constant value
Comparator Block, not equal single-precision floating-point format comparison with constant value
Comparator Block, equal 32-bit signed int comparison with constant value
Comparator Block, greater than 32-bit signed integer comparison with constant value
Comparator Block, less than 32-bit signed integer comparison with constant value
Comparator Block, not equal 32-bit signed integer comparison with constant value
Down Counter Block performs the function of an Down Counter in accordance with control signal and received configuration.
Up Counter Block performs the function of an Up Counter in accordance with control signal and received configuration.

Binary Coder Block analyses input signals state strictly inorder in 32 downto in 1 and detects the number of inputs that are equal to 1. First detected number will be outputted in accordance with control signal.

Binary Coder Bus Block analyses input signals state strictly inorder in 32 downto in 1 and detects the bit mask of inputs that are equal to 1. A bit mask will be outputted in accordance with control signal.
Damper Block with float data format
Damper Block with signed int data format
Damper Block with float data format
Damper Block with signed int data format
Binary Decoder Block sets the needed output to state 1 in accordance with the received number and control signal.
Binary Decoder Block sets outputs to state 1 in accordance with bits set in the received number and control signal.
Derive Block performs derivative calculation function in accordance with control signals.
Derive Block performs derivative calculation function in accordance with control signals.
Divider Block with float data format
Divider Block with signed int data format
The D Flip-Flop Block captures the value of the D-input at a decay portion of the clock cycle.
The D Flip-Flop Block captures the value of the D-input at a front portion of the clock cycle.
Set/Reset Block performs input data validity checking, sets or resets the input data to 1 or 0 state respectively and outputs the result. The Reset signal has the priority.
Set/Reset Block performs input data validity checking, sets or resets the input data to 1 or 0 state respectively and outputs the result. The Reset signal has the priority.
If the T input is high, the T Flip-Flop changes state ("toggles") whenever the clock input is strobed. If the T input is low, the Flip-Flop holds the previous value. Changes state at a decay.
If the T input is high, the T Flip-Flop changes state ("toggles") whenever the clock input is strobed. If the T input is low, the Flip-Flop holds the previous value. Changes state at a front.
Integral Block performs integral calculation function in accordance with control signals.
Integral Block performs integral calculation function in accordance with control signals.
Latch Block performs a latching of the input(floating-point) value by decay and outputs result in accordance with control signal.
Latch Block performs a latching of the input(signed integer) value by decay and outputs result in accordance with control signal.
Latch Block performs a latching of the input(floating-point) value by front and outputs result in accordance with control signal.
Latch Block performs a latching of the input(signed integer) value by front and outputs result in accordance with control signal.
Latch Block performs a latching of the input(floating-point) value by state and outputs result in accordance with control signal.
Latch Block performs a latching of the input(signed integer) value by state and outputs result in accordance with control signal.
Latch Block performs a latching of the input(floating-point) value by one cycle and outputs result in accordance with control signal.
Latch Block performs a latching of the input(signed integer) value by one cycle and outputs result in accordance with control signal.
Limiter Block limits the value of a signal to be within the range specified by tunable limits.
Limiter Block limits the value of a signal to be within the range specified by tunable limits.
Limiter Block limits the value of a signal to be within the range specified by tunable limits.
Limiter Block limits the value of a signal to be within the range specified by tunable limits.
Function Block outputs the absolute value of the input signal
Function Block outputs the absolute value of the input signal in signed integer data forma
Function Block outputs the inversion value of the input signal in accordance with control signals
Function Block outputs the square root calculation result
Analog mismatch block
Analog mismatch block with limits
Analog mismatch block with limits
Analog mismatch block
Multiply Block with float data format
Multiply Block with signed int data format
NOT Block outputs the logical inverse of the input in accordance with control signal.
OR Block outputs the logical OR operation for inputs in accordance with control signal.
Polynomial function Block performs evaluation of polynomial coefficients on input values in accordance with control signal.
Scaling Block, 16-bit unsigned integer to 16-bit unsigned integer
Scaling Block, 16-bit unsigned integer to single-precision floating-point
Scaling Block, 16-bit unsigned integer to 32-bit signed integer
Scaling Block, single-precision floating-point to 16-bit unsigned integer
Scaling Block, single-precision floating-point to single-precision floating-point

Scaling Block, 32-bit signed integer to 16-bit unsigned integer
Scaling Block, 32-bit signed integer to single-precision floating-point
Scaling Block, 32-bit signed integer to 32-bit signed integer
Locking and simulation module
Subtract Block with float data format
Multiply Block with signed int data format.
Multiplexor Block selects one of two floating-point input signals and output result in accordance with control signal.
Multiplexor Block selects one of two signed integer input signals and output result in accordance with control signal.

Time Counter Block with dynamic time value, turn off delay function
Time Counter Block with dynamic time value, turn on delay function

Time Counter Block with dynamic time value, single vibrator function

Time Counter Block with constant time value, turn off delay function
Time Counter Block with constant time value, turn on delay function

Time Counter Block with constant time value, single vibrator function
Majority Block is intended to define majority decision in accordance with control signal and received configuration.
XOR Block outputs the logical XOR operation for inputs in accordance with control signal.
Converts big-endian to little-endian
Converts big-endian to little-endian
Converts big-endian to little-endian
Converts little-endian to big-endian
Converts big-endian to liggle-endian
Converts little-endian to big-endian
